Detailed Description

XML nodes iterator through files.

This class implements an iterator for the childs of a node that can optional load an extranl file provide by an attribute of this node to provide extra tags

This allow to easily provide configuration externalization in optional files.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

Simple child iterator.

Creates an iterator for the child nodes of node

TREX::utils::ext_iterator::ext_iterator ( rapidxml::xml_node<> const &  node,
std::string const &  conf 
)

Child and external config iterator.

Parameters:
node An XML node
conf An optional attribute of node

Creates an iterator that allows to iterate on both the childs of node and on the content of the file referred by the attribute conf. If conf attribute does not exist the instance will only iterate through the childs. If conf exist it will also iterate thought the childs of the root node fo the referred file.

Precondition:
if conf attribute exist it must be an existing file
this file should be a valid and non empty XML file
Exceptions:
std::runtime_error Failed to open the file
rapidxml::parse_error Unable to parse the file
XmlError The file is empty
Exception file not found

Member Function Documentation

bool TREX::utils::ext_iterator::external (  )  const [inline]

Check for external node.

This method helps user to identify whether the referred node is a direct child of the node used for initial construction or if it is coming from the file loaded with an optional tag

Return values:
true if the referred node is coming from the file loaded with external tag
false otherwise
Note:
As soon as this value becomes true all valid successor will be external too.
if hasExternal() is false then this method will never return true
See also:
bool hasExternal() const

ext_iterator ext_iterator::externalBegin ( char *  name = NULL  )  const

First external node.

Parameters:
name A tag name

This method creates a node pointing to the first node with tag name that is external

Returns:
the iterator pointing to firts external node or an invalid node if this iterator has no external node
Note:
if @ name is NULL or not given this method just look for the first external node
